SEARCH
Package pamViewFX.fxNodes.pamAxis

Class PamAxisPane2

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
pamViewFX.fxNodes.pamAxis.PamAxisPane2
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class PamAxisPane2 extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
Axis which utilises the javafx number axis instead of the graphics inside pamaxis.

A PamAxisFX is still used to handle conversion of data values and pixels etc.

Note: Eventually PamAxisFX should be removed from this and a replaced by a much simpler class that handles pixel to data conversion.

Author:
Jamie Macaulay

    • getPosition

      public double getPosition(double dataValue)
      Convenience function. Exactly the same as PamAxisFX

      The axis knows all about scale and can tell us the pixel value for any given data value.

      Parameters:
      datavalue - - the value of the data
      Returns:
      position in pixels along the axis for a given data value.

    • getDataValue

      public double getDataValue(double pixelVal)
      Convenience function. Exactly the same as PamAxisFX.

      Converts a position on the plot into a data value based on the axis max, min and scale.

      This is the exact compliment of getPosition()

      Parameters:
      position - along the axis in pixels.
      Returns:
      data value.
